key_title: Key to the species of Rhagodia

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Chenopodiaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Chenopodiaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Chenopodiaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves less than 5 mm long; plants intricately branched and spinescent
Mature leaves covered by a shining, scaly layer or surfaces glabrescent
Mature leaves dull, mealy with an indumentum of vesicular hairs
Leaves flat, broader than c. 2 mm; plants chiefly coastal
Leaves fusiform or semi-terete, to c. 2 mm broad; plants of the far north-west only
Leaves mostly more than 2 cm long, covered with irregular vesicular hairs; plants not spinescent
Leaves mostly less than 2 cm long, covered with spherical to saucer-shaped vesicular hairs; plants divaricately branched, usually spinescent
